titleStmt.title: Agrippa, King of Alba, or, The false Tiberinus as it was several times acted with great applause before His Grace the Duke of Ormond then Lord Lieutenant of Ireland, at the Theatre Royal in Dublin / from the French of Monsieur Quinault.
titleStmt.author: Dancer, John, fl. 1660-1675.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A56909 of text R3936 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing Q214). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 114 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 35 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: Agrippa, King of Alba, or, The false Tiberinus as it was several times acted with great applause before His Grace the Duke of Ormond then Lord Lieutenant of Ireland, at the Theatre Royal in Dublin / from the French of Monsieur Quinault.

Quinault, Philippe, 1635-1688. Agrippa, roi d'Albe.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J.C. for Nich. Cox ...,

notesStmt.note: Translator's dedication to Lady Mary Cavendish signed: J.D. [i.e. John Dancer].
Freely adapted from "Agrippa, roi d'Albe." Cf. Nicoll, A. Restoration drama, 1923, p. 89.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
